text: Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Jakie dziwne! Początkowo dziwna metaliczność delikatnie dominuje aromat, bardzo szybko jednak ucieka i wpuszcza pomieszanie dobrego, młodego lambika i figowo-karmelowych nut beczki. Super!
Bottle thanks to Jacob - Pours dirty gold white head - nose/taste of sherry, oak, lemon, minerally funk and nutty sourness - medium body
Bottle. Orange color. Woody aroma: sherry, light acidity and sweetness, wine. Taste: slightly sour, dry sherry, raisins and a little nuts.
CBC2015, Pours yellow to orange with a medium head, aroma of cherries, fruits, acidity, flavor is sour with cherries, medium bodied, nice
37,5cl bottle. Clear orange color. Thin white head. Light sweetness and bitterness. Medium sourness. Body is medium. Finish is dry. Aroma is cheese, barnyard, citric, malt, spices, herby.

Bottle shared by martjoobolut, my first ever unblended Lambic - massive thanks! Style tick 76/77. Real nice funky, farmhousy, apple cidery aroma and flavour. Sour with apple skin bitterness. Its woody dry but not too barrely, in fact, I dont get much sherry in this. Could very well be because I dont think Ive ever had Amontillado. Crisp carbonation. Seems rather simple - not too much going on, but still very nice.

375ml bottle (thanks martjoobolut). Clear pale amber color. No head. Leather, fruity, peach and or apricot, faint caramel, balsamico and twiggy in aroma. Cherry stones, fruity, acidic, woody, earthy in taste. Sharp acidic mouthfeel. Goat cheese in aftertaste. Flat. Light body. Not my mug of brew, but can drink.

Light amber colour. Almost no froth. Vinegar, wood, hints of grass, funk, hints of sherry. Sour, bitter beginning. Dried apples, vinegar in the middle. Wood. Sour finish. Dry. As an unblended lambic it is nice but still somehow flat.

Bottle (AS nad young venecia sherry beer aged 18 months in amontillado barrel). Pours amber. Aroma is sour, fruity, funky, lacto. Flavor is sour, fruits, lemonade, some bitterness, some dryness. Overall: good.

Bottle shared by Mart. Nose is citric, funky, tart, apple notes, oak, balsamico. Flavor is citric, slightly musty, wood, lactic notes. Finishes with apple peels, lemony sourness, tart notes, wood. A bit too simple for its own good and a bit dirty.

May 2, 2015. Bottle at CBC2015, red session. 
Light hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is oak, minerals, some fruity apple and grape notes, grain, sherry. Taste is tart, slightly vinous, sweet and funky. Finish is oak, minerals, sherry, acidic. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.

sampled @ 2de Bierproeffestival van De Dijleschuimers. Pours unclear blonde, no real head. Smell is more dirty than the Jerez version. Taste is sharp, sour, dirt , oak, mild funk. Enjoyed the Jerez much more.

(Thx!) 375 ml. bottle sampled @ 2de Bierproeffestival van De Dijleschuimers. Sampled side-by-side with Sherry Jerez one. Drank as Venencia Sherry Beer. Same as this one, I assume. Darker one, orange with no head. Nose is hugely milky, lactic buttery, popcorn lambiek, reminiscent of lesser unblended Girardin. Taste is watery lemon, butter popcorn, spoiled butter, watery, lemon, dull, Watery unblended lambiek body. Too buttery, spoiled lambiek, Reminscent of a weaker Girardin, Expensive stuff looking at that one, passable but not too crazy about that one.

Bottle 375ml. Thx Tommy.
Pours hazy orange with low white head. Aroma is of oak, cardboard, malt, candi sugar. Taste is of candi sugar, cardboard, acidity, oxydized stuff. Palate: Light-medium body. Soft-medium carbonation. Overall: Good, nice acidity. Nothing overdone. Genuine. Oxydized.

Bottle (375 ml) at home. Split 2-ways with Minderbinder. Slightly hazy bright amber with a small bubbly white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is pretty interesting at first and probably could be confused with a real unblended lambic. Its oaky and earthy with a mild funk but also some oxidation and carboard notes. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately sour with oak, earthy notes, tobacco, oxidation and mild funk. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Mineral finish. Pretty close to the real thing and also quite tasty.

Pours a sparkling clear copper (or maybe strong golden) with a small white white head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of tobacco, dried autumn leaves and sherry over a lambic base. Taste is moderately tart and earthy with more oxidative notes. Body is light and carbonation moderate, mouthfeel just incredibly vinous. Certainly a unique experience, much enjoyed!

Aroma is farmyard, some yeast, spices, wood, apple skins, mild sherry and also some slight herbal notes. Flavour is sour wood, bready malts, some yeast, spices, herbs and earth with a nice almost lactic tone to it. Wellbalanced, but a bit "raw" compared to the Mad Old Lambic BA Sherry Jerez.
Draught at CBC2015. Clear golden - no head. Musky. Grapes. Wooden. Honey. Light acid. Bretty. Ok barnyard. Wet mouldy wood. Tartness. Light boozy. Nice.
Bottled at CBC 2015. Clear orange colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, oak, spice, tartness and acidic.

Bottled at CBC15. Deep golden with no head. Aroma is sour, vinegar, grainy, funky barny brett notes and grapes. Taste is sour, malt, yeasty bretty notes, wood, boozy barrel notes, funk and tart green fruit/grape notes.
CBC. Clear golden without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard, wood and light sherry. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Dry and light acidic finish. 010515
Bottle @ CBC. Orange with no head. Aroma is malt, tart, barnyard, lemon, fruit, sour and brett. Flavour is malt, barnyard, fruit, sour, brett, lemon, medium sweet and a little dry.
[5/1/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 1st session. Golden. Funky aroma, very vinous, with fruit and wood. Sour flavor, funky, vinous.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours golden, no hard. Aroma of light sourness, barn, yeast, apples, grapes, wet wood, light sherry. Flavor is sour, malt, yeasty, wood, barn, funk, tart fruity, green apples, grapes, sherry notes. Medium body, flat carbonation, light acidic finish. 010515

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2015 - amberish pour with white head. Acidic fruity aroma and taste, berry fruits, light fruity spice, some sherry infused wooden notes, tart and dry finish.
Bottle @ CBC 2015, red session. Hazy orange pour with lacings. Funk, sweat, floral notes, horse blanket, some apple skin and lemon zest.

Bottle 375ml. @ CBC 2015 [ Blue Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, Sparta Hallen, Gunnar Nu Hansens Plads 11, 2100 Copenhagen, Denmark [ As Mad Young Lambic BA Sherry Amontillado ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, funky, barnyard, apple - green apples, wood, grapes - berries. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a long duration, tart, funky, fruity - berries - grapes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is flat. [20150501]
37.5 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is mild spiced, toasted and slight fruity. Dry and slight malty, citric. Dry and slight wooden, herbal dry finish.
Tap at CBC 2015. Pours hazy azy orange with a ring white head.  Aroma of wood, fruits and strange alcohol from barrel. Light sweet and sour. Light to medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at CBC 2015. 
Clear amber coloured with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of caramel and amontillado.
Fruity and light acidic flavour of oak.
Tart finish.

375 ml bottle @ CBC2015 (red session). Pours a dark orange colour with a small head. Aroma of gooseberries, cough medicin and citrus. Flavour of raw grapefruit sourness, gooseberries, sherry sweetness, floral notes and wood. Medium bodied. Dry, easy and sharp.
